III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (v) Peer-on-peer discipline.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation While placed at Vassar, youth was restrained by two other youth.
During this time, two staff members were restraining another
youth.
Investigation On 05/03/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Chief
Administrator (CA) at CFC. CA was advised that a special
investigation was being initiated and a request was made for
incident reports from Vassar House that ranged from October
2022 and March 2023. CA reported Staff 1 was still employed
with the agency, but is currently off on administrative leave. CA
denied recalling any incidents involving a youth a Vassar House
that urinated on herself as a result of being restrained. On
05/25/2023, CA confirmed Staff 1 was no longer employed with
the agency.
On 05/03/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Clinical
Director (CD). CD denied any recollection of major incidents
between Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D while placed at
the facility.
On 05/05/2023 a telephone call was completed with Staff 1. She
agreed to meet at Vassar for an interview on May 8, 2023, at
noon. Staff 1 failed to show for the scheduled visit. A phone call
was made to Staff 1. She reported she is currently grieving the
lost of her father and would like some time to process all that is
concurring. Staff 1 indicated she would not be able to come into
this office for an interview and requested to complete the interview
via zoom within a few weeks. Another call was made on
05/25/2023 to Staff 1. A voicemail message was left requesting a
return call. A text message was also sent with a request to return
call. To date, there has been no contact with Staff 1. She is no
longer employed by the agency.
On 05/09/2023 a telephone call was made to the complainant. A
voicemail was left requesting a return call. A text message was
also sent requesting a return call. A follow up email was sent on
06/07/2023 and a response was received indicating complainant
would not be available until 6/19/2023.
2

On 06/07/2023 a telephone interview was completed with Youth
A. Youth A has been released from Vassar and is currently
residing with her family. Youth A confirmed she was placed in
Vassar House between October 2022 and March 2023. She
recalled being placed in Units 2, 3 and 4 during her stay at the
agency. She specifically recalled staying in Unit 2 with Youth B,
Youth C and Youth D all together during the reported time frame.
Youth A denied she participated in a restraint involving Youth B
and Youth C. She further stated she did not participate in the
restraint of any youth in the program. Youth A reported she
witnessed a restraint between Youth E and Youth F. She reported
Staff 5 was the only staff present and she intervened
appropriately. Youth A denied Staff 1 was present during any
restraint that she witnessed.
On 06/07/2023 a telephone interview was completed with Youth
B. Youth B is currently placed with family. Youth B confirmed she
was placed at Vassar during the timeframe of October 2022 and
March 2023. She was unable to recall which units she was in
during the duration of her placement. Youth B denied participating
in a restraint of Youth C along with Youth A. She also denied
participating in the restraint of any youth at Vassar. Youth B
recalled Youth C would urinate on herself on purpose but denied
specific knowledge of the youth urinating on herself as a result of
a restraint. Youth B denied seeing youth restrain other youth at
the facility. She further denied seeing restraints of youth by staff
that were not appropriate. She stated all restraints that she saw
were warranted and staff were always present and would redirect
inappropriate behavior of youth. Youth B denied she was ever
restrained while placed at Vassar.
On 06/08/2023 a video interview was completed with Youth C at
Bay Pines. Youth C recalled being placed in all different units
while placed at Vassar. She stated she recalled being placed in
Unit 2 along with Youth A, Youth B and Youth D. Youth C stated
Youth A and Youth B attempted to restrain her, but they couldn’t.
She recalled the encounter lasted about three minutes. She
reported she punched Youth A and Youth B to get them off of her.
She recalled it happened in October as it was before her birthday.
Youth C denied recalling which staff was present. Youth C denied
an instance when she was restrained and urinated on herself.
Youth C reported witnessing Youth A restraining Youth D. She
denied recalling which staff was present but confirmed the staff
stepped between the youth to get them to stop. Youth C recalled
an instance when Youth D was attempting to fight her, and Youth
C ended up getting restrained by Staff 1. Youth C denied staff
3

would fail to intervene but felt that it would take staff a long time to
respond.
On 06/08/2023 a video interview was completed with Youth D at
Kent County Juvenile Detention Center. Youth D recalled being
placed at Vassar from June 2022 until February 15, 2023. She
reported being assigned to both Unit 2 and Unit 4 during her time
at the facility. She specifically recalled being placed with Youth A,
Youth B and Youth C while in Unit 2. Youth D denied knowledge
or recollection of a time when Youth A and Youth B restrained
Youth C. She denied knowledge of a time when Youth C would
urinate on herself as the result of a restraint. Youth D does not
remember Youth C being restrained by staff or youth at the facility.
Youth D reported staff would always redirect any negative actions
of youth in the program and any restraints she witnessed were
done correctly. Youth D denied a time when she was restrained
by Staff 1 and denied seeing youth on youth restraints at the
facility.
On 06/09/2023 in-person interviews were completed with Staff 2,
Staff 3 and Staff 4 at CFC. All staff confirmed they were
employed with Vassar House prior to working for CFC. All staff
denied knowledge of youth restraining youth at the facility and
specifically denied knowledge of Staff 1 participating in restraints
of Youth C. In addition, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 all reported
staff at Vassar house would immediately respond to any
inappropriate actions (i.e youth on youth restraints) of youth at the
facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Face Sheet for Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D
• HR Information of Staff 1
Staff 1 is up to date on training and has one write up in her
file related to attendance dated 04/15/2023. Staff 1 was
terminated effective 05/16/2023 for failure to return from a
personal leave that began on 04/16/2023.
• Various Incident Reports from Vassar House ranging
from dates of October 2022 and March 2023 – Review of
Incident Reports from this time frame failed to document a
specific incident involving a youth-on-youth restraint that
resulted in Youth C urinating on herself and staff failing to
intervene.
• Various Special Investigation Reports for Vassar –
Review of SIRs from this time frame document some areas
of non-compliance and some instances where staff failed to
4

perform their job duties, however none of the reports
involved staff failing to perform their job duties while Youth
A and Youth B are restraining Youth C.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was not sufficient
evidence to confirm non-compliance with licensing rule 400.4158.
The youth interviewed denied youth on youth restraints occurred
and further reported staff would intervene and redirect any
inappropriate behavior of youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
